desc: Students investigate contemporary approaches to classical issues in metaphysics, which include the mind-body problem; personal identity and immortality; space and time; causality; and realism, anti-realism, and truth. Specific issues discussed vary from year to year. May be repeated if topics are different. Offered in alternate years. Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either PHIL 235 or PHIL 236 or permission of the department chair.
name: Sem: Metaphysics
notes: Prerequisite: Two courses in Philosophy, one of which must be PHIL 235 or PHIL 236. Open to rising Seniors and Juniors only.
title: Seminar in Metaphysics
